verses.verse: In the year<WH8141> that king<WH4428> Uzziah<WH5818> died<WH4194> I saw<WH7200> the<WH853> Lord<WH136> sitting<WH3427> upon a throne<WH3678>, high<WH7311> and lifted up<WH5375>; and his train<WH7757> filled<WH4392> the temple<WH1964>.

Above <WH4605> him stood<WH5975> the seraphim<WH8314>: each one<WH259> had six<WH8337> wings<WH3671>; with twain<WH8147> he covered<WH3680> his face<WH6440>, and with twain<WH8147> he covered<WH3680> his feet<WH7272>, and with twain<WH8147> he did fly<WH5774>.
And one cried<WH7121> unto another<WH559>, and said, Holy<WH6918>, holy<WH6918>, holy<WH6918>, is Jehovah<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>: the whole earth<WH776> is full<WH4393> of his glory<WH3519>.
And the foundations<WH520> of the thresholds<WH5592> shook<WH5128> at the voice<WH6963> of him that cried<WH7121>, and the house<WH1004> was filled<WH4390> with smoke<WH6227>.

Then said<WH559> I<WH188>, Woe is me<WH1820>! for I am undone; because I am a man<WH376> of unclean<WH2931> lips<WH8193>, and I dwell<WH3427> in the midst<WH8432> of a people<WH5971> of unclean<WH2931> lips<WH8193>: for mine eyes<WH5869> have seen<WH7200> the King<WH4428>, Jehovah<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>.
Then flew<WH5774> one<WH259> of the seraphim<WH8314> unto me<WH7531>, having a live coal in his hand<WH3027>, which he had taken<WH3947> with the tongs<WH4457> from off the altar<WH4196>:

and he touched<WH5060> my mouth<WH6310> with it<WH559>, and said, Lo<WH5060>, this hath touched thy lips<WH8193>; and thine iniquity<WH5771> is taken away<WH5493>, and thy sin<WH2403> forgiven<WH3722>.
And I heard<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of the Lord<WH136>, saying<WH559>, Whom shall I send<WH7971>, and who will go<WH3212> for us<WH559>? Then I said, Here am I<WH7971>; send me.
And he said<WH559>, Go<WH3212>, and tell<WH559> this people<WH5971>, Hear<WH8085> ye indeed<WH8085>, but understand<WH995> not<WH7200>; and see ye indeed<WH7200>, but perceive not<WH3045>.

Make the heart<WH3820> of this people<WH5971> fat<WH8080>, and make their ears<WH241> heavy<WH3513>, and shut<WH8173> their eyes<WH5869>; lest they see<WH7200> with their eyes<WH5869>, and hear<WH8085> with their ears<WH241>, and understand<WH995> with their heart<WH3824>, and turn<WH7725> again<WH7495>, and be healed.

Then said<WH559> I<WH136>, Lord, how long<WH559>? And he answered, Until cities<WH5892> be waste<WH7582> without inhabitant<WH3427>, and houses<WH1004> without man<WH120>, and the land<WH127> become utterly<WH8077> waste<WH7582>,
and Jehovah<WH3068> have removed<WH7368> men<WH120> far away<WH7368>, and the forsaken<WH5805> places be many<WH7227> in the midst<WH7130> of the land<WH776>.

And if there be yet a tenth<WH6224> in it<WH7725>, it also shall in turn be eaten<WH1197> up<WH424>: as a terebinth, and as an oak<WH437>, whose stock<WH4678> remaineth<WH7995>, when they are felled; so the holy<WH6944> seed<WH2233> is the stock thereof<WH4678>.
